newsitem.title: USA: CBOT wheat slip on pessimism over exports.
newsitem.headline: CBOT wheat slip on pessimism over exports.

text.p: CBOT wheat futures fell early on pessimism about increased exports of U.S. wheat despite transportation snarls in Canada, traders said.
Japan's Food Agency said it has no plant to resort to buying more U.S. wheat despite serious shipping delays at Canadian ports.
Traders said Cargill Inc sold one million bushels of March and Dean Witter sold one half million March.
At 0958 CST, wheat was two to 4-1/2 cents lower, with March down 4-1/2 at $3.57-1/2 per bushel.
